item.title: 🔥 Other sites like Steemit!? I have found 4. Here is the list! Will they work? 🔥
item.description:
![stme.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTcs9f18eAzCwr3TAeGU6eCYvH2GWAPjfikaZTCpefrd1/stme.jpg)
### Do you want to know where else you can make money from blogging? Here is a small list of the possible competitors for Steem, that I collected today, after searching for other blockchain based social media sites.
**Blockchain is rapidly developing and challenging "old" social media sites like Facebook, Twitter and their purpose is to reward users or content creators that can bring more readers or giving value to the site.** **Looks like Steemit is still the biggest and fastest growing site of all, but you never know in these fastchanging world. Just take a look.** ### Today I made a little search and found these similar sites:
https://scrypto.io/uploads/logo_image/logo.png
## [Scrypto](scrypto.io) #### It will reward you in different cryptocurrencies, they say they can pay in 100 cryptos after the full release, so it might be a good idea to have an account there.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/patreon_public_assets/toolbox/patreon.png ## [Patreon](https://patreon.com/invite/jvnvqo) #### This is a bit different site. Here you do your job and curators can subscribe to your service, photo, novel writing or whatever. They will contribute to your work monthly or after each post. You can decide. I do not know if this would work or not but sure worth to try. Having their ongoing support means you spend less time thinking about business, and more time creating. [Patreon](https://patreon.com/invite/jvnvqo)
![syn.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSoDjYFeKEG2NX6PMHjz33LViZ96kSPfGDKSH7A2k3KPU/syn.png)
## [Synereo](http://synereo.com) #### It is still under development but you can pre-register now. They say on their website: > Synereo is developing tools which allow content creators to easily monetize original works without having to turn their channels into advertisment real estate, while granting their followers the opportunity to be rewarded for getting the word out. ![yo.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmR2SfVabcnJTMjL7TqTRDeVXa5GSnEjzfqEY5bqp53DCY/yo.jpg) ## [Yoyow](http://yoyow.org) #### It is like Steem for the Chinese community but I could not get much info about it hence I cannot speak or read Chinese.

item.title: KCN The price of bitcoin has set a new record - $4200
item.description: Bitcoin conquered the $4200 mark. According to the charts of Coinmarketcap, this price was set in the morning of Sunday, August 13. The bitcoin’s market capitalization exceeded $68 billion. Analysts noted the increased investors’ interest for bitcoin, after it has successfully survived the fork on August 1. Among other favorable factors are the upcoming activation of the SegWit protocol and the increased demand for the cryptocurrency on the Japanese markets. Bitcoin has demonstrated more than 300% growth, as at the beginning of the year its price was less than $1000. The price predictions of the bitcoin experts vary, converging to the fact that bitcoin will retrace the stages of gold in its cryptocurrency evolution, becoming in time a costly benchmark, rather than a small change. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5jE5klUOWjc

item.title: We MUST use our numbers to edit this wikipedia page for Steemit! It unfairly mentions how "Others point out that steem might be a Ponzi scheme" and needs A LOT of updating to EDUCATE the public on how steem REALLY works, and include all our achievements!
item.description:
Please take a second to look over the very unfair wikipedia page for steemit with barely any real information about how steem blockchain even works! We should all do our part to help edit this to become more fair and highlight our accomplishments as both a social media website AND a blockchain! https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steemit ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmW6zTUhG4tE6Xmjn8FkMPE1DoDzMMSrdEQoxCJW8NeurX/image.png) Look at this wikipedia page! It has obviously been written or edited by someone who doesn't even understand how steemit works or how SERIOUS it is! I Understand that this may just be a result of steemit having been brand new last year and you have to have a healthy skepticism of a new ICO or website like this promising to pay users to post when no other social media had ever been able to do this. And of course people will fear the unknown and call any successful new crypto currency system a ponzi scheme, but the ending of this post "Controversy" is very unfair because all it does is place doubt in the minds of someone READING about steemit. And people reading about steemit on wikipedia are USUALLY going to be all the people who are thinking about signing up! They're checking wikipedia to read up on it to se if it is worth their time and that bullshit attack on steemit is unfounded and simply an attack, it needs to be removed. Why do they even have to include a "controversy" page? I bet there are a lot of other wikipedia pages for websites without a controversy page that SHOULD have one but Steemit has NO signs of being a ponzi so we don't deserve that unfair comment like a black mark on our wiki page! It is NOT FAIR to the READERS to just MENTION that SOME PEOPLE think steemit is a ponzi scheme as if that has any merit or is worth mentioning at all! Some people think they are the only person that exists and everyone else is part of their imagination, doesnt mean you need to mention it! Some people think a lot of things, I didnt know we were just putting in HEARSAY as wikipedia citations! In fact that is a great reason to get that sentence removed! It's heresay! And it's also not cited, "Some" people? Well who said it and why is their opinion important and what do they say now a year later? ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQsNRVV6PdXk7HANxmgZYr9VXeKisa4wuqctTjWAiBWtz/image.png) I understand that when steemit first came out people were skeptical, but its been OVER a year now, and its getting really annoying like when some people are still calling bitcoin a ponzi scheme, it's just ignorant and annoying. And I know steemit is still relatively new, but the time for editing this wikipedia article has come because Steemit has proven itself! And we have also proven all sorts of things as a community, I mean we haven't even had payout problems! People have payout problems on poloniex and all sorts of exchanges and websites and yet steemit pays people like clockwork without fail and no one ever gives us credit for that! Steemit is also never down and no one ever gives us credit for that either ....It's time we get aggressive with our advertising and promotion of steemit! If we don't get aggressive then almost noone will ever find out about us because we have such a small budget for ads! We could be having a million new users join a month if some of us tried, and we could be getting bigger user growth faster if we ALL try! We ALL have the power of marketing and can each single handedly bring 1000 people to steemit! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPt9fpbeUnPvN3DwV2hpBNnJKV5wo7JVqz3V7ufMTXhUq/image.png) I had been actually looking for a reason to bring up these articles. i recently had the spontaneous idea of "Wikipedia Marketing" and I thought to myself" Ok Wikipedia Marketing MUST already be a thing, there's probably even guides for it" and I found one on inc.com . https://www.inc.com/managing/articles/201001/wikipedia.html It gives a great list of ways you can ethicaly and professionally add information about your new business without crossing that thin line into Spam, linking to thid partu sites, starting out by creating a stub, using the discussion page which we will excell with our strength in numbers, volunteering to edit other blockchain and crypto related posts on wikipedia, and other organic methods to create high quality wiki pages for your business etc. We can learn from it while finding ways to improve this article on steemit WHICH needs to be A LOT longer and more detailed. I'm talking several pages long with FULL descriptions of EVERYTHING steemit uses to work! This will require an article on Steempower, Steam Dollars, Delegation, Voting Power, and another article on Witnesses and so on, it will be easy to come up with many articles and maybe separate pages to then link back to the main steemit page, maybe even add steemit links to pages about Bitcoin or Blockchain etc. We should be adding information and links about steemit on non steemit but blockchain related pages, like on the Blockchain page itself, we will be able to make true statements about how Steem has the MOST transactions or how its the most energy efficient or has most users, we have all sorts of records we can use on the crypto currency opr blockchain wiki to get the name steemit to just show up more! Wikipedia can bring us MILLIONS of users if people researching Bitcoin and Blockchain and CryptoCurrency wiki pages start seeing the name Steemit and Steem blockchain everywhere! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPKQBPnxEvaUxDrCuCET4cHAu6LAF2T2JzfNVyEpYPVY4/image.png) if just 1000 of us bring 1000 people each to steemit that's 1 million new users! And look at @jerrybanfield he has definitely brought MORE than 1000 users to steemit, possibly even 10,000 because I mean he's got over 10,000 followers and got most of them in the last few months from his social media youtube facebook campaigns! Because when you get people to sign up for steemit they tend to just follow you first. So just imagine how much money you can make from promoting steemit for FREE on social media!! We all win! a 360 win as Alex Jones would say. And this wikipedia page can be a powerful tool to promote steemit and since wikipedia marketing is an established practice, we can use it and we can create many new pages to link back to it, but the important part is that we stay organic, authentic, sincere and ethical! And remember that just 1 person can use marketing to change the world even if its just by saving money and using some of it to build a hospital! Maybe the idea of one person changing the world was not as posible before the internet, but now one person can do a lot with the computer and internet as a Force Multiplier, letting one man have the power of 10 men! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmexDzAkLs6hqGNW6N5UamzE9rdJYoWSJJ12wvckoeCwar/image.png) So let's start signing up to wikipedia, making changes on the steemit page, and add more accurate information and try to Polish the image of steemit, because this page was obviously edited or partially written by some people with some negative opinions about steemit or why else would they include that unfounded and unfair "possible ponzi scheme" hearsay comment? We can do better than this! Let's be "respectfully" aggressive but also legally ruthless. Hey if people can patent Aids medicine and raise the price 1000 percent, and if people can legally make billions of dollars from the Invasion of Iraq in 2003, then we should not feel guilty editing a fucking wikipedia page to promote our DECENTRALIZED social media site which can CHANGE THE WORLD FOR THE BETTER and SO WHAT if we fucking make some money doing it....everyone who invested in bitcoin early on DESERVED to become millionaires or billionaires! PLEASE do not throw a wrench in our progress by LIMITING yourself! BE AGGRESSIVE because STEEMIT DESERVES TO WIN. it will raise the living standards of billions of human beings and potentially END POVERTY on this fucking planet JUST from abolishing criminal inflationary monetary practices ALONE! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWLpXTsZYXoAnYUk7V5XyFt2XpUSn814WVJnbe7eZzbbo/image.png) ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQdX4nQkuUcsrkCvtbH6CYAFDjk2qWydqbCcX6vucPytq/image.png) (image by @ilyastarar ) Ok sorry for my outburst above, but I get pissed when I realize how global poverty could have been wiped out before I was even born, and then again several times during my lifetime, so let's just not waste anymore time because lifting 2 billion humans out of poverty benefits the RICH more than the poor! Imagine 2 billion more people making tens of thousands of dollars a year instead of just hundreds, theyd be benefitting their employers and making money for the global economy and theyd be able to pay so much more in taxes so governments should like that to. Now this next thought doesn't relate very much to what Im talking about here, but I just have a great anger in me, I don't want to promote the community doing immoral unethical things to grow, but I see so many people getting ahead doing things that are seen as "immoral" or "unethical" and I feel like we should do whatever we can to grow steem blockchain as well because it can't hurt anyone and it's only going to benefit humanity and the planet ....sorry to anyone who is assuming I am suggesting we...I dunno...i really don't..it could be anything! I know we want to represent steemit well, we shouldn't "spam" social media to promote steemit, but it's not spam if we all simply give authentic comments all at the same time! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTWczUrHg4zaR4rcmphuS1UieXNWuS9Bcdhs29VKdBuUt/image.png) Blockchain is the future, Steem is the best blockchain for the masses, and that steemit.com only helps people around the world, and since I have discovered a Niche, an ability to make money off of helping others, that i should continue this path! You must honestly want to help someone, zero in on someone from Africa, India, Latin America (venezuelans need our help badly) any steemit user you see in the developing world, please find one you like, promote them like I have for @tj4real and @bania and @xpency (who i thought was dead after leaving steemit , lol hes back though and was just sick) make a post about them! send them some SBD and help them out and make a post about it! You will then make the money back, and create a cycle of generosity! ![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmdc4DhFz4V9qrqzGfjNgmwe1u2eYVZETjCt6UmUwDNqym/image.png) (Cool image I found when google image searching "Bitcoin Poverty" and now i am interested in this Bitcoin across America Bus) ##### If you have questions about bitcoin steemit crypto or making money mining or marketing, feel free to email me zackza@gmail.com or text/call me (619) 302 0398 and....
[Follow @Ackza](http:///www.steemit.com/@ackza)
![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmchZuJ7EBy3TDAyb4K66ghTup81JwAN2iUNz93Ck9f2Bp/image.png)

item.title: BTC-E Will Distribute 55% of User Assets, Remaining 45% are Currency-specific IoU Tokens
item.description:
![btc-e-logo.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmY1a23o37rCoRamMTQGhuYLkzii3TqK3eMT2xvDUu7hme/btc-e-logo.png)
The ongoing BTC-E exchange situation continues to spark debates among cryptocurrency enthusiasts. In the previous update, the company announced the creation of an IOU token and reduction of customer balances. After getting a lot of community feedback, it appears those plans have been changed once again. It is good to see the company work on new solutions, though.
NEW BTC-E UPDATE OFFERS SOME GOOD NEWS
Ever since the BTC-E exchange platform went offline and the domain was seized by government officials, cryptocurrency users have been asking many questions. The main pressing issue is whether or not customer funds are safe. For now, that is not entirely the case, although the BTC-E team claims they have access to roughly 555% of all customer funds right now. The remaining money has officially been seized by government officials and law enforcement agencies, with no chance of recovering it, by the look of things.This leaves a big financial hole to fill by the company.
In the previous update shared with the world, it appears the BTC-E team would give all users a balance haircut. More specifically, the missing 45% of funds would be deducted from user balances and they would receive an IOU token in return. Every single token would be valued at US$1 and can be redeemed at market rates at any given time, assuming there is enough demand for them. This proposal didn’t sit all too well with the cryptocurrency community, though.
BTC-E received a lot of viable feedback from the community and came u up with a new plan. The goal of the company is to treat all users fairly and ensure the missing funds can be recuperated in one way or another. According to their new plan, there will be a recalculation of all currency balances. This will be done by taking the available assets into account as well. This means 55% of all current balances will be credited as currency immediately, with the remaining 45% left in the form of a specific currency token.
All currencies will get their associated “IOU” token, which can be traded on the exchange free of charge. These tokens will not have a fixed market price, which means there is plenty of room for arbitrage opportunities and recovering some initial losses pretty quickly. However, they will never have more value than their face value, which means the room for financial gain is pretty limited unless you step in at the right time. It is a fair plan, all things considered, and one that makes it clearer to users as to which outstanding balances they have yet to recuperate.
The current plan by BTC-E is to eventually redeem all outstanding tokens, although it is hard to tell how long this process will take. If the Bitfinex IOU situation is to be considered, the process can be settled as quickly as a few months from now. It’s far from an ideal situation, but it guarantees BTC-E users will eventually get their money back in one way or another. It’s good customers get the option to either trade at face value or try to get rid of them below the normal price in an effort to move all funds out of the exchange sooner rather than later.
BTC-E users who had 1 BTC in their account balance will receive 0.55 BTC and 0.45 BTCT in the near future. The actual cryptocurrency funds can be transferred out immediately if the users prefer to take that course of action. Remaining tokens will be available for trade or exchange at face value at a later unspecified date. It is a simple process, yet it remains a bit unclear when users will be able to access their balances. This plan by BTC-E seems pretty solid, to say the least, although it remains to be seen how long it takes to recover all missing funds accordingly.
Courtesy of Jdebunt

item.title: Is this $4400 Bitcoin day?
item.description:
May may REGRET selling their Bitcoins for $4000 if the Bitcoin momentum train continues to rocket up higher.
So far, Bitcoin is the King of Cryptos, no doubt.
Many are selling their Ripple XRP and their other losing Cryptos now to jump on the Bitcoin momentum train.
People are lined up on the bid side and FIGHTING to get Bitcoins, still.
Amazing to watch!

item.title: Bitcoin is the new gold? Then why is it valued 113x less?
item.description:
https://s20.postimg.org/j3aszskv1/Bitcoin_Gold.jpg
Bitcoin and Gold have been compared in many ways and more and more investors are now seeing that the two have a LOT in common:
* They store value * They are seen as a hedge to the "system" when things turn bad (Financial Crisis, War...) * Like Gold, Bitcoin is not controlled by one Central Bank or country * There are a finite number of gold and Bitcoin which makes your asset not subject to dilution
*"I think the world is starting to realise that, just like gold is a good hedge, bitcoin is a great hedge against the system because it’s outside the system,"* says Bobby Lee, the CEO of BTCC, one of China's biggest bitcoin exchanges.
During the last days, financial markets have gone south, whereas the Bitcoin keeps getting higher.
Therefore the current Bull Market we are experiencing on Bitcoin might just be the beginning if we look at these 2 charts. If both of these assets serve the same purposes defined above then they should be valued more or less the same don't you think?
**Market Cap in USD of Bitcoin, Cryptocurencies and Gold**
https://s20.postimg.org/w8qb5weql/Crypto-_Gol-_BTC.jpg
*Gold still holds most of the value of this "Safe Heaven, decentralised Bet":*
https://s20.postimg.org/mcttjzycd/Safe_Bet_Gold_aka.jpg
Image [1](https://www.google.fr/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiZ_-uC3NbVAhVFElAKHU7CDIcQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vaultoro.com%2F&psig=AFQjCNFCwIaUK9pDV_JbDdvl7lXUrb90qg&ust=1502799896089969)

item.title: Mining Poll
item.description:
![9fab2d05918700b745b7ae369db11381.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRqRTxQEH48xKR8RLCHgLaqtSGqT74pf1FEkgyS4bq8WG/9fab2d05918700b745b7ae369db11381.jpg)
Mining or just a waste of resources and time?
Just a small poll, I did a while ago some experiments mining Feathercoin and Worldcoin, just for fun and using the full node client. Nowadays it appears not really to make sense anymore, but well, doesn't hurt to give it a try.
So what would be your suggestions for a single PC/GPU mining exercise, can be pooled or not. Any altcoin is of interest, Steem unfortunately does not seem to be possible anymore.
Let the ideas come :)
(pic: pinterest.com)

item.title: Blockchain Use Cases: From Image Mining & Virtual Economy to Crowdfunding
item.description:
